Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer breached procedural fairness and erred in assessing Parveen's likelihood of economic establishment
Application_Facts: Parveen provided a job offer unrelated to nursing; insufficient language skills for intended occupation
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of immigration application rejection
Court_Ruling: No breach of procedural fairness; officer's determination was reasonable
Claimant_Status: Applicant for immigration seeking economic establishment
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer issued pre-refusal letter and rejected application based on language proficiency concerns
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of procedural fairness and unreasonable assessment of economic establishment
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard for administrative decisions; procedural fairness requires opportunity to respond but not duty to seek clarification
Assessment_Factor: Language proficiency, relevance of job offer to intended occupation, likelihood of economic establishment
Procedural_Issue: Pre-refusal letter provided; applicant responded but officer maintained concerns
Evidence_Used: Job offer letter, language test results, application materials
Application_Basis: Economic class immigration application under Canadian immigration law
Relief_Sought: Certification of question for appeal and setting aside of refusal decision
Governing_Rule: Officer's decisions on economic establishment are reviewed for reasonableness; procedural fairness does not require officer to seek additional information
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of language ability relevant to intended occupation
Outcome: Judicial review dismissed; no appeal certified
Harm_Assessment: Immigration application denied, delaying or preventing entry to Canada
Cause_Description: Rejection based on inadequate language proficiency affecting likelihood of economic establishment
Evidence_Handling: Officer considered submitted documents and determined they did not address economic establishment concerns
Evidence_Issues: Job offer not aligned with applicantâ€™s professional background; language scores below required threshold
Evidence_Assessment: Officer reasonably concluded that job offer and language skills were insufficient for economic establishment
Decision_Rationale: Applicant's language abilities were insufficient for intended occupation; job offer did not mitigate concerns; procedural fairness upheld
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of relevant job offer and insufficient language evidence
